entry.title: pushing and popping
entry.summary:
Today's blog post will be about da pushing and da poppin'. More specifically the shell kind.

pushd <dir> is like cd <dir> except that it puts your previous location on the directory stack before changing directory.

The directory stack can be inspected with dirs. The top is on the left.

It is possible to go back to a previous directory (and pop the current one of the stack) using popd.

This should be useful!
